snippet: Ugandan officials said that of four military helicopters that took off from Uganda for Somalia on Sunday, only one made it to a refueling stop in Kenya.
abstract: Ugandan military has shifted heavy weaponry, including assault aircraft, into Somalia over the past few weeks, vowing to strike a final and decisive blow against the Shabab Islamist militant group; officials report that of four military helicopters that took off from Uganda for Somalia, only one made it to a refueling stop in Kenya.

byline.contributor: Josh Kron contributed reporting from Kampala, Uganda, and Reuben Kyama from Nairobi.

lead_paragraph: Ugandan officials said that of four military helicopters that took off from Uganda for Somalia on Sunday, only one made it to a refueling stop in Kenya.

headline.seo: Ugandan Move on Somali Militants Begins With Helicopter Crash
headline.main: Copter Crash May Hinder Offensive in Somalia
headline.print_headline: Copter Crash May Hinder Offensive In Somalia
